message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.SE, cs.DC, cs.SY 

This paper discusses vulnerabilities in virtual switches used in cloud operating systems, which can lead to compromising cloud systems via the data plane. The paper focuses on security issues and network infrastructure, which are typically covered in the categories of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper discusses the logical centralization of networks and the need to revisit threat models, which are relevant to categories such as cs.SE (Software Engineering) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper evaluates the performance overhead of existing mitigations, which is related to the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
